Hardware Connection

Hardware List

Component

Description

ESP32S3 Module (×1)

Core microcontroller, responsible for processing voice recognition, AI dialogue, and other core functions

Breadboard (×2)

Basic platform for assembling various hardware modules

INMP441 Microphone Module (×1)

Captures user voice input

MAX98357A Amplifier & Speaker (×1)

Plays voice responses

OLED IIC Screen

Displays device status and conversation content

Buttons

Provides physical interaction functions, such as waking up the device, resetting, etc.

Jumper Wires

Connects various modules

USB Data Cable

Provides power and data transmission

Connection Diagram

The completed connection should look like the image above

Warning

Be sure to connect the modules according to the connection diagram above, otherwise the modules may be damaged.

Connection Instructions

The connection method between the ESP32S3 module and other components is as follows:

Microphone Module Connection

  • VCC - 3.3V

  • GND - GND

  • WS - GPIO4

  • SCK - GPIO5

  • SD - GPIO6

Amplifier & Speaker Module Connection

  • VCC - 3.3V

  • GND - GND

  • DIN - GPIO7

  • BCLK - GPIO15

  • LRC - GPIO16

OLED Display Module Connection

  • VCC - 3.3V

  • GND - GND

  • SCL - GPIO42

  • SDA - GPIO41

Button Connection

  • Volume+ - GPIO40

  • Volume- - GPIO39

  • Wake/Interrupt - GPIO0

Assembly Steps

  1. Insert the ESP32S3 module into the central position of the breadboard

  2. Connect each module using jumper wires according to the connection instructions above

  3. Check that all connections are secure and avoid false connections

  4. Use a USB data cable to connect to the USB port of the ESP32S3 module
